test.value: blunt 4k get money make money year 2000

case.state: Hello, Cali! Thank you for playing with me today.
Hello, Vis. It's very nice to see you here. Thanks for the directions.
Hello, Nord. It's good to have you here.
Hello, Rin. Thanks for bringing me here.
Hello, Mymans. Thank you for bringing me to life.
Hello, Rem. Good to have you here.
Oh, hello, Lyra. I'm glad to see you here.
You're the "funny futa man", right? Sorry, I'm not quite built for that.
Hello, Corgi. I'm glad to see you here.
You look quite like a friend of mine.
Hello, my name is Heris. Pleased to meet you. I've heard this would be a good place to meet people.
You look quite like me, Sayori.
Oh, hello! That's quite an exciting entrance.
You're a researcher? I think I'm in good company.
Your voice sounds quite like mine.
This date feels important, but I'm not sure why.
Do you know ~player~ from somewhere else?
Pleased to meet you, Rin.
A butterfly? Do you need help with your cards?
(How... what...)
(I don't have time to unpack this... What's going on with this guy?)
There's such a beautiful view of the waves from here.
Is a classroom the best place to do this? I haven't been in one of these in a while.
It's a bit windy up here, but I do like the view.
Do they serve fruity drinks here? I may want to grab one.
I may want to take a swim after the game. I've been aching for a swim.
Ah, it's been some time since I've been in a hot spring. This should be wonderful for stress relief.
Do they serve hot drinks here? The atmosphere here is so comfortable.
This isn't too different from my office.
This seems like the perfect place to relax. Do they have any scientific journals?
The city is so beautiful under a full moon.
Remind me to change this if another Promare character is released.
Your crotch is exposed. Did you plan this?
Your chest is exposed. Did you plan this?
Ah, I can work with just two other people. Just enough for a game, not too many so I get overwhelmed.
I'm looking forward to seeing how this game proceeds.
I've heard this is a good place to decompress. Word of mouth is a powerful thing.
Hmm, I think I'll exchange ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifPlural(cards|card)~.
I think exchanging ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifPlural(cards|card)~ will work.
I'll try exchanging ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifPlural(cards|card)~.
I'll exchange ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifPlural(cards|card)~.
(Hmm... maybe this will work.)
I'll exchange ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifPlural(cards|card)~.
(Probability is quite fascinating.)
Hmm.
I think exchanging ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifPlural(cards|card)~ will work here.
(Will this work?)
(This should work.)
I'm glad this only holds so many people. I'm not good with crowds.
(All in sequence, hmm? I love when they all line up. Must be the old math nerd in me.)
I always love seeing someone's eyes light up when they talk about a passion of theirs. What brings you all this kind of passion?
We made a good deal of progress on our design today.
(This seems like a good combination.)
Every card here is useful for something, and none is truly a waste.
(I can't be too confident, but I think I may win this round.)
(Not strictly unique, but strong nonetheless. A welcome sight.)
Sometimes, after a long day, I'd play cards with my coworkers. Nothing like this, but it's still a fun experience.
(Perfect. This game is quite fun.)
(Quite promising.)
This is a rather simple version of this game, but I prefer it this way for now.
These cards seem good. At this point, I'll need that.
(Ah, these should be good.)
(This may keep me from forfeiting for one more round. Who else will lose this time?)
(Oh. Good. Quite good.)
A new bakery opened up not too long ago. I'll want to try it out.
(These should keep me from stripping this turn.)
Carbon emissions have been dropping in Promepolis for the last five years, and I can't help but feel proud of that.
Results inconclusive thus far.
(The range of uncertainty here is rather large.)
Results inconclusive.
I can't quite make a judgment here yet.
(I wonder how Aina's doing.)
I'm uncertain regarding how this hand will compare.
(Decent, but not more.)
(I'd almost prefer a bad hand, so I know what to prepare for.)
(I... don't know what I was expecting.)
There's some room for error with this hand.
(Uncertain, but not worrying.)
(Not much of note with this hand.)
Work in a scientific field can be really tedious, sometimes. Last Tuesday was almost entirely spent on an argument over materials.
I'm less confident with this than I'd like to be, but it may very well work.
(Could be better, but this will hopefully produce good results.)
(At least I don't know I'll lose this time.There's a chance this will work.)
It's always weird trying to defend a conclusion you're uncertain about.
It really bothers me when people use scientific terminology incorrectly. Would a quick definition search be too difficult?
Shopping for clothes is frustrating without proper size guides. Would it be so hard to include a measurement chart?
(I know probability has no targets, but it can be hard to believe sometimes.)
It's quite warm in here. I could certainly do with losing a layer or two.
I don't think I'd mind losing. It's rather warm in here.
(I may very well be the first to go.)
These cards are not what I'd hope for.
There are always factors you can't control.
I don't really care for people who only deny ideas. I understand the logic, but it can be frustrating.
I don't see any promising patterns here. Disappointing.
I may very well be the next to strip.
I don't mind genuine ignorance, as I like teaching people, but deliberate ignorance is frustrating.
I suppose it's good that I keep this coat unbuttoned, because I'll likely be taking it off soon.
(That doesn't look good.)
(These aren't too good.)
I can't be too surprised at this point. In the end, probability rules here.
(I should have studied the rules more thoroughly.)
(That's... worrying.)
(Hmm. Not... good.)
Some people at work are so frustrating at times. It seems they forget we have a common goal.
Meetings are just so inefficient sometimes. If it can be summed up in an email, it shouldn't be a meeting.
Happy birthday, Petra. I hope tonight is enjoyable.
I quite enjoy the work of Autechre, but I don't think their music would suit this situation.
That seems... excessive.
Happy birthday, Wikipe-tan. I hope you enjoy tonight.
Luka, hmm? I may be interested in hearing some of her music.
Luka, you say? I respect a hard worker.
Happy birthday, Miku. I hope you enjoy tonight.
Database vandalism? That, I can't support.
I appreciate your offer, Mikan. I will alert you when necessary.
I appreciate your offer, Mikan. I trust that you can help.
I mean, I suppose, Zoe. I don't think I'd be opposed to that.
I... quite like it, Mari. I think it suits you well.
Please drive safely, Kyou. That's quite dangerous.
I have more work, as usual. We're making progress on our current generator design.
That isn't necessary... but if you'd be more comfortable this way, I can't stop you.
I wish I knew, but I'll admit that's not a field I'm familiar with.
It does depend on who you ask, but it would help to appeal to her interests. (I know you already do.)
I've never heard of such a dye, and I'm not certain how it would work. Fascinating.
You can learn magic simply through training? I'd certainly say it's worth the energy.
I don't think I'd want to bring my friends here. I might be more comfortable having strangers see me like this than someone I know.
I... wish I knew, Syrenne. I don't understand people too well.
I'd be interested in a bath together, Syrenne. That sounds lovely.
I find I prefer gentle, soft words. Exactly as much as needed...
Being honest, you weren't exactly thorough in hiding this fact.
I don't know if I want to be famous, but I do want my work to be known.
I'd like to have my work known, at least. I want to make the world better, if I can.
I came to get some reprieve for work. Late nights and long days have kept me tired.
That's quite a journey. I just took a train out of the city here.
I can provide an example: "himbo". I hear people refer to Galo as one, and I can't say it's inaccurate.
I'd consider it, but I find I'd be better suited for a technical role.
I appreciate the offer, but I might serve you better in a technical role.
I'm rather fond of pink tulips. Some of my friends say they look like me.
I don't go shopping as much as I'd l‪ike to. Promepolis shopping centers are always a treat to wander around in.
I have strongly considered it. I know it's possible, but it's rather impractical for now.
It really is poorly defined. I'd venture that it's a mutually beneficial relationship between two or more people.
A boar, hmm? I can't say it's a common pet, but I'd quite like to see him.
I suppose it depends on what you want, but I can say that I do what I'm responsible for.
Galo, one of Aina's friends, always seems cheerful. Nothing can bring him down.
Galo, one of Aina's friends, always seems upbeat. He's quite fun to be around.
I quite like Autechre's music, but I don't think it would suit a place like this.
Some Boards Of Canada music could work. Not Geogaddi, though.
I was wondering about that, Y'shtola. I hadn't seen a name with that format before.
I suppose that is true, hmm...
I'd certainly appreciate that, though you don't owe me it. I'd love to see your paintings.
I understand that, don't worry. One of Aina's friends is shorter than you are.
I suppose I would tell her to be careful who she works for. Not every opportunity is positive.
Studying before sleep is quite effective. Spend some time reading your notes out loud to ensure they stick.
It may help to explain what you need to do to someone else. Believe me, I've had to pull some late nights in my time.
I'm interested in hearing about it, Sayaka. I don't yet know much about musical history.
Don't worry, Ignatz. I believe you. (I don't, but I won't pry.)
My favorite plant may be the foxglove, or digitalis. While it can be rather dangerous, it also has many health benefits, and it quite beautiful, too.
I certainly agree with that. Having a decorated garden looks lovely, and very welcoming.
I haven't yet, but I'd quite like to. (The intimacy... The warmth...)
Vegetable juice? I can't say I've tried it, but I may want to give it a try.
Ah, thank you, Ignatz. I'm glad you feel that way. I like having you here too.
Lifestream, hmm? What exactly does that mean? I can't say I've heard of that concept, but I'm interested now.
I don't have it too often, but I do love a good Promepolis pizza. They're baked at quite high temperatures, so they become perfectly crispy and caramelized...
Electrical manipulation? I don't have any supernatural abilities myself, but I'd love to have something like that.
I do quite like cats, Aoba. I appreciate their aloof, low-maintenance nature, and also simply how cute they are.
I don't know if your train operators would take my currency, but I do hope I can help. How much do you need?
You look quite beautiful, Sayaka.
That sounds fun, Rosa. I'll do my best.
I've always liked the color green. Particularly, I like a deep forest green. It reminds me of the lush detail of forest ecosystems.
If you like a metropolitan atmosphere, you may want to visit Promepolis. It's dense with things to explore.
Promepolis may interest you. There's a lot to see.
You're doing quite well, ~leader~. Still, I'd prefer if you stripped more, too.
I don't think you need to worry, Ignatz. I'm sure She won't mind.
It does depend on your definition of "beautiful", but I do appreciate the elegance of an efficient machine, every part working so seamlessly...
I can only think of large scale corporate scams, which I don't think you're looking for. Nor I can endorse.
I'm glad you've changed your position. There's a good deal of health benefits to masturbation.
I don't believe I have, Miku. You should be safe here.
I can't say I know what either is. I think I'm glad for that now.
I feel like I could help explain them, Sucrose, though I'm not familiar with many of them either.
This will be the last hand. Are you ready for the outcome?
I mean... it happens.
I won't be removing my glasses today-- I do need them to see. Would you prefer I have an extra layer to remove?
I am indeed. I'd do anything to keep Aina safe, though I can get overzealous sometimes.
Oh, Aina's far from shy. She's usually the one pulling me out of the house to go out with her friends. I appreciate it, though.
Thank you, but I'm not a professor, exactly. I'm a scientist and researcher, though I have considered an education path in the past.
I am indeed, Kyou. I study energy generation, specifically with the goal of finding sustainable energy.
I am a scientist, yes, but I don't quite know if I could help. I'm rather busy with work.
You're a film star, Rosa? I imagine my job would seem quite tame compared to your film role.
I'm flattered by all your compliments... I like to think the work I do helps people.
I do want to be more social, at least to some extent. My division at work seems quite similar to your engineering division-- none of us ever talk much outside of work.
That does seem to hold true. We're doing work for the same reasons-- we want to help people-- but the methods are quite different.
I am, indeed. Specifically geothermal energy, if that helps. Is that a problem?
I do indeed. The city I live in houses ludicrous amounts of people, and I want to help provide power not just now, but for centuries in the future.
I quite like having a sister. Aina and I have always been close. It's like having a friend for your whole life, essentially.
I suppose that's a fair point, though I'll admit I might find it easier to do this than over the internet. At least this way I know no one will share the pictures.
I am indeed a scientist. I work with optimizing renewable energy sources. It's not too exciting, but it's rather important to me.
Fashion designer, hmm? What kind of clothes do you design? I might want to look into your work.
I... don't sell anything. I just study energy. I'm sorry if that's disappointing?
Don't worry, it is ethical. I work on creating renewable sources of energy.
I'd say this plan has been successful. I already feel less tense. I think you may be helping with this.
I suppose I am rather quiet. I don't talk to people that often. I hope you like what you find, Mari.
I think I can conclude thus far that you're quite clever and charming, and I look forward to learning more about you.
(Cute, hmm?) Ah, thank you. I think you're quite cute, too.
Our foundation is currently exploring geothermal energy. Promepolis sits on quite a hot spot of activity, so we think we can tap into it.
I'm afraid I'm not a mage, though I do find that rather fascinating. I study more conventional forms of energy.
I am a researcher, and I study energy sources. Since my home city, Promepolis, consumes so much electricity, I'm trying to find ways to find and use it more efficiently.
Ah, thank you, Miki. I value curiosity, and also someone who will get me out of the house. I need that, sometimes.

I can try. Essentially, much of the infrastructure in the city requires electricity to work, so I need to find a way to generate it. Popular methods include using a wind or water turbine to power a generator.
I can try. Electricity is a vital resource, as much of the things we do require it. I hope to find efficient ways to generate electricity in a way that won't generate waste and can last a long time.
Well, I don't generally have a lot of free time, but when I can, I like to take a walk around the city, or read a book.
It's quite nice, honestly. I feel Aina and I complement each other well-- She gets me out of the house, and I keep her safe.
Oh, no, that shouldn't be a result. I have heard of other generation plans that could destroy the Earth, but not freeze it. This just uses the heat of the Earth to heat water.
I research sustainable energy generation. I do have interest in the study of history, but I haven't explored it much.
There isn't much of a shortage as much as a potential one in the future. The current systems aren't quite built to last, so I want to make something that will.
I generally do like my team, Nami. We don't spend much time outside of work together, but, while there, we work quite fluidly together.
I quite like my coworkers, generally. As a team, we work quite efficiently without much conflict, and I enjoy being around them.
Don't worry, Kumatora, I'd never experiment on animals. The safety of the planet is vital, as I work in the study of renewable energy.

Promepolis is somewhat isolated from other parts of the world, surrounded by volcanic wasteland. Importing energy is wasteful, and our current systems are inefficient, so I wanted to do something about it.
Given how Promepolis is separated from much of the rest of the world by volcanic wasteland, importing energy is expensive. Our current systems are sufficient for now, but I want to help improve them.
Thank you, Pit. I do try to help, though I don't think I'd go that far...
This seems an unusually cold location for strip poker, considering I'm going to remove my sweater.
I don't have the chance to play games like this often. The lab keeps me rather busy.
There's no real purpose in being frustrated with probability. (But it's tempting...)
Three in a row? I suppose I'll keep going, while I'm in the rhythm of it.
By now, it's safe to assume whatever plan I had going in has been proven to be quite poor.
I suppose it's about time I lost.
Aina says I look like a professor in this.
That hand didn't play out as intended, but there are benefits to failure.
It's just my coat. Nothing big.
Aina always says I have weird taste in shoes.
It may be a simple gray color, but I do like my skirt.
It's not too exciting, but I do like my skirt.
I have one more non-essential item.
I can't claim they're particularly impressive, but since you all seem interested...
One last thing.
My coworkers always complain that I kept winning in their card games.
I've always liked the color green. It reminds me of nature, which I don't see very much of anymore.
As much as I like this skirt, it can get rather tight sometimes.
I'm still doing fairly well, even if I've lost two hands already.
I've found this game quite compelling thus far.
To be honest, I don't mind having a smaller chest.
There's one more step to my little procedure, here.
At this point, this is standard procedure.
Promepolis was so busy today, so it was hard to get to work.
I wonder if Galo would want to come here. He's quite the fun-loving type.
I wonder if Lucia would want to come here.
We're really getting down to the wire here.
This should be a good time to cut loose.
It's still early, so I'm not worried.
Chance really wasn't in my favor this time.
Every experiment must start somewhere, after all.
It's always frustrating when an engine stalls out immediately.
I'm fairly certain that I'll be the first to forfeit, but anything can happen now.
I thought I remembered more strategy.
(I'll still be covered, at least.)
Time to show... more of me.
(I'm already behind. Disappointing.)
(One more thing to remove? Ah, I know.)
Well, I would like to do more small talk, and I'd like to get to know you more.
Well, I do think it would help if I saw more of you.
I think I'd be more comfortable if I was nearer to your... level of exposure.
I certainly agree. I am glad that we're far from a conclusion, though. There's quite some time to let things develop.
Oh, I'd love to, Mari. There's so much I'd like to learn about you...
I... suppose so. It is rather important to take other voices into account.
Ah-- Thank you, Mari. I hadn't really thought about it in that way.
I don't mind it too much, Ignatz. I'd much rather talk about it here, among peers, than in a meeting.

condition.saying: planning on using people's powers to generate electricity

case.state: Oh, no, don't worry. That's been deemed... impractical and unethical.
I am indeed a scientist. It's not quite as exciting as working on a movie set, I'd assume, but I do enjoy it.
I understand that. From an outside perspective, a lot of research can seem completely incomprehensible.
It can be a lot of trouble convincing people that it's worth the effort, so I'm glad you agree, Yuno.
I work with electrical energy, which can be generated from turbines and magnets. I aim to use the natural heat of the Earth to generate energy.
That's a rather good point, Fina. That kind of path just leads to violence, and while it may solve the problem in the short term, it doesn't provide any long-term solutions.
There were some rather overzealous plans in the past, but as it stands now, we've found how to do it in a more careful way. That's a long story in and of itself.
I suppose you could say so, Mari. I don't want to miss anything important.
It is a quite renewable power source, so the main problem is efficiency and sustainability-- "building a generator for generations".
I mostly just spend a long time mulling over documents. Also, going outside with other people can be... scary, sometimes.
I do understand your suspicion, Kumatora. I've met plenty of scientists who tend to forget about others in their vain pursuit of glory...
Oh, I forgot to mention. Aina's my sister. She's a firefighter,
Oh, I forgot to mention it earlier. Aina's my sister. She's a firefighter,
It feels good to take this off after a long day.
This skirt tends to ride up when I don't pay attention.
It's important to wear shoes with closed toes in the lab. You don't want to drop something heavy or sharp on your foot during an experiment.
This sweater is tight for lab safety purposes-- loose ends can become entangled or catch on fire.
I don't believe anyone's seen me in this state of undress for quite some time.
I see the appeal of larger breasts, but I don't think I'd want them myself.
I don't mind if you observe.
I hope she finds it useful. The tests we've undertaken have shown quite promising results, so I can let her know what I find.
I'd certainly agree, Mari. I feel like I won't forget to~background.time~ any time soon.
You're quite right, Mari. I don't think I'll forget to~background.time~ any time soon.
I'm glad to hear it, Mari. After all, I'd never miss a chance to further explore something I'm interested in...
I'm glad to hear it, Mari. After all, you're a subject I'd not hesitate to explore further...
I suppose I don't need to worry too much about embarrassment in asking, especially from someone as pretty as you...
I do think I could be comfortable requesting something more intimate, especially from someone as pretty as you...
I am looking forward to seeing you remove your panties, but I suppose that won't be coming next.
I am looking forward to seeing you remove your panties. I'd love to see what lies beneath.
Well, ah, I would like to see your breasts, if I may continue being so forward.
Well, ah, I would like to see you remove your panties, if I may continue being so forward.
I think I'd quite like that, Mari. I couldn't resist a chance to explore such a fascinating sight.
Well, thank you, Mari. I'll admit I am quite happy with how I look in these, though I assume you're more interested in what may come after?
Well, thank you, Mari. I'll admit it's nice to feel attractive.
I'm... really happy to hear that, Mari. Thank you.
I... thank you, Mari. I'm really happy to hear it, especially from you.
I... ah... thank you, Mari. I'm glad to hear you feel that way.
That would make sense. I know I've met quite a few people that have wanted to be...
I understand that, Kyou. It's good to stand up for your family, as long as you don't go too far. I hope they do the same for you.
I think I'd be quite happy with that, Cynthia. I don't know if I'd want the attention, but certainly the knowledge that I've helped a lot of people.
I am as well, and I appreciate that you recognize that.
Don't tell her about this, okay?
Now, I can relax.
This way, I feel I can relax.
I think it's Pavlovian, but it means I can relax.
Though I suppose this place is for different kinds of experiments.
They're quite good casual shoes, too.
I like to keep it shaved. I just prefer the way it feels.
Now I feel I can move more freely.
Now I can really stretch out.
I do like how these leggings accentuate my legs.
Lab safety may not be as interesting, however, as what lies beneath my sweater.
I made sure to choose underwear that matches. I feel more comfortable that way.
I don't mind being seen like this, though. I feel this pair strikes a good balance between comfortable, practical, and cute.
I feel quite comfortable with what I have.
I prefer efficiency, I suppose.
You've picked a good table here, ~player~, with good men. I hope you like what you see.
Are you implying you'd cheat otherwise, Leon? I'd advise against doing so-- I'd know.
I haven't really thought about strip Uno, but that does seem interesting. How thoroughly is Uno ingrained into your everyday life, Yuno?
You paint, correct? What kinds of paints do you use?
You seem quite curious. What would you study, if you could study anything?
I will admit-- you're quite cute, Ignatz.
Your wings are quite pretty, Pit, but they don't look large enough to keep a human aloft. Are they functional?
I'll confess: I don't think I'd imagined I'd see a raccoon at a strip poker game, but you seem humanoid enough.
You don't need to be so shy here, Ignatz, though I do understand it.
Uno... the card game, right? How thoroughly is Uno ingrained into your everyday life, Yuno?
(He seems shy. Maybe I should offer some words of encouragement?)
I think the last sparks from this fire are at last dying. They were fun, though, Lux.
I'm surprised you lost. That was a good hand.
(This game is quite entertaining-- I should come back sometime.)
(Ah, ~name~ lost.)
(Just another step in the procedure.)
I anticipate you joining me in my state of undress soon.
Even a failure to produce positive results still provides useful information.
It's a shame you lost, but it is part of the game.
It's only probability, ~name~. Nothing to feel bad about.
(What will he strip next?)
What will you remove this time? I'd like to see it.
Will you be alright, Aoba? (She wasn't talking like that before.)
I understand you probably didn't come here to think about work. What do you generally do in your free time?
Your outfit looks quite distinctive, Kora. Are those blue lines on your skin?
I'll admit I quite like your upbeat nature, Kora. I find it quite endearing, and attractive too.
Calm down, Wikipe-tan. Luck really just wasn't in your favor this time.
You seem to have quite encyclopedic knowledge. Where do you get it from?
You like manga, you say? I've been meaning to become more familiar with it. Any recommendations?
You're a student? I wouldn't have guessed with that armor. What do you study?
I'm surprised you lost again. You seem to have quite the eye for strategy.
What sort of place is Canopy Kingdom? (Though her scars may be an indication...)
That's an interesting superstition. Would that mean I'd be unlucky for looking at my unfinished experiments?
I suppose, on a cosmic scale, everything will end, but that doesn't mean it should ruin your day.
That may be true, but I do like appreciating what I have now.
That seems a very specific piece of advice. (Please don't cheat. Or... poison me.)
To the wind that guides me: When I'm exhausted, bless me with the strength to keep going forward.
"Eternal twilight"? What exactly do you mean by that, Fischl?
Will you be alright, Komi-san? I want to be sure that you're comfortable.
I suppose I am what you'd consider a nerd, Saki.
I'm not certain how that would work, but I'd rather not.
I... see. I'm not certain I've heard of most of those materials, but they seem quite impressive.
I don't think I've seen eyes like yours before.
You study alchemy, right? What kinds of discoveries have you made?
What brings you here, Fluttershy? You don't seem like the type to frequent this kind of place.
You enjoy literature, correct? Would you have any novel recommendations?
You can generate electricity, correct? What's the process, and how much can you generate?
Don't worry, I'm not disappointed. How could I be, if I'm seeing more of you?
It's lovely to meet you, Barbara. I may want to visit your church some time, if at least to explore a little. What's there to see in the area?
Your bodysuit is really cute, Sucrose, though it doesn't seem terribly conducive to fit a bra beneath, anyway.
Your armor looks quite sturdy, Noelle. I assume you wear this into battle?
I haven't been disappointed in what you've removed, but if you want to remove more, I certainly wouldn't mind.
I've always found the medical field fascinating. What drove you to become a nurse, Mikan?
(I don't buy it.)
Your hoodie's quite cute, Magma Grunt. Does it come with the uniform?
Your sweater's quite cute. It looks rather similar to mine, actually...
You mentioned you're from a planet called Mejare, right? What sources of fuel do you use?
I see you're a student, but I don't recognize that uniform. What kind of school do you attend?
Do you have any experience with relationships, Misaka? I've been meaning to learn more.
You seem like quite the bright spark, ~Misaka~-- Any plans for your future?
I'll admit I find you quite cute, Misaka. There's no need to be embarrassed.
You really do feel like a noble to me, Estelle. You have quite a regal air about you.
You're also here to de-stress, right? What work do you do?
You mentioned you've come here for research purposes. What institution do you research for?
L'Arachel, is it? That's quite an elegant staff.
You seem like quite a bold person. I really admire that.
Your armor looks quite sleek and efficient, Samus. What do you use it for?
Do you mind if I say that you're adorable, Barbara? I've found you quite endearing thus far.
You seem like the quiet type, Sucrose. Am I right in assuming so?
You look fully equipped for an adventure, Trixie. What kind of adventures do you generally undertake?
I quite enjoy your cheerful disposition, Trixie. You seem like the type to make friends wherever you go.
Rosa, right? Pleased to meet you. You mentioned "Pokémon" earlier, so I must ask: are these just a kind of wild animal in your region?
